text: The 2002 Turkish Cup Final was a football match played on 3 April 2002 at the Bursa Atatürk Stadium in Bursa. It was the final and deciding match of the 2001–02 Turkish Cup. ==Match details== {| width=92% |- | | |} {| width="100%" |valign="top" width="50%"| {| style="font-size:90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" |colspan=4|Kocaelispor: |- !width=25| !!width=25| |- |GK ||77 || Ahmet Şahin |- |DF ||18|| Cihan Haspolatlı |- |DF ||2|| Faruk Sarman |- |DF ||8 || Orhan Ak || || |- |DF ||5 || Nuri Çolak |- |MF ||13 || Ahmet Arslaner |- |MF ||15 || Ayman Abdel-Aziz || |- |MF ||10 || Aleksandar Aleksandrov || || |- |MF ||33|| Cem Sinan Vergül |- |FW ||7|| Roman Dąbrowski |- |FW ||11 || Zdravko Lazarov || || |- |colspan=3|Substitutes: |- |GK ||1 || Metin Mert |- |DF ||3 || Engin Öztonga || || |- |DF ||6 || Hasan Yiğit || |- |MF ||9 || Kwame Ayew || || |- |MF ||17 || Ömer Aysan Barıș || |- |FW ||21 || Bülent Kaan Bilgen |- |FW ||41 || Serdar Topraktepe || || |- |- |colspan=3|Manager: |- |colspan=4| Hikmet Karaman |- |colspan=3| |- |colspan=4| |- |} |valign="top" width="50%"| {| style="font- size:90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align=center |colspan=4|Beşiktaş: |- !width=25| !!width=25| |- |GK ||1 || Thomas Myhre |- |DF ||18 || Erman Güraçar || |- |DF ||4 || Ahmet Yıldırım |- |DF ||5|| Ronaldo Guiaro |- |DF ||19 || İbrahim Üzülmez |- |MF ||3 || Tayfur Havutçu || |- |MF ||7 || Zoubeir Baya |- |MF ||17 || Tamer Tuna || || |- |MF ||20 || Tümer Metin || || |- |FW ||10 || Ahmet Dursun |- |FW ||26 || İlhan Mansız |- |colspan=3|Substitutes: |- |GK ||33 || Mattias Asper |- |DF ||14 || Ümit Bozkurt || || |- |DF ||16 || Dmitri Khlestov |- |DF ||25 || Ali Eren Beşerler |- |MF ||11 || Bayram Bektaş |- |FW ||9 || Arild Stavrum |- |FW ||15 || Sertan Eser || || |- |colspan=3|Manager: |- |colspan=4| Christoph Daum |} |} ==References== * 2002 Turkish Cup Final 2002 Turkish Cup Final 2005
